title: Intercut experimental wood type system
content:
Before graduating from MassArt last May, I spent a semester (and then some) working on an experimental wood typeface design / production project. The project was recently selected to be featured in a [Contemporary Letterpress](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317173530/http:/www.mcla.edu/Gallery51/0703/) exhibition, so I figured it would be a good time to put all my process together for others to see.  
You can read more than you probably ever would want to at [nicksherman.com/design/Intercut](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317173530/http:/www.nicksherman.com/design/Intercut).

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317173530im_/http:/typophile.com/files/print-AOEG_RHN-both-680_6558.jpg)
author: Nick Sherman

comments.content: Saw these on Flickr last night, Nick. I am very impressed with both the product and your presentation of it. When will you start selling prints?

I'm a great lover of woodtype. This is quite impressive.  
Very nice work!
Thanks for sharing this Nick - as a fellow MA typophile I applaud your work - very cool.
I am also interested in prints!

While I'm not a great lover of wood type... but this really is quite impressive! :-)

hhp

Beautiful...

I am proud to say that I live in JP with you! :D

EDIT: I just realized that I have one of your letterpress posters from the show last summer.

I have found your site before. It was intriguing to me that there are someone who actually like letters carved in wood; is interested on them beyond their forms, not digital, where they are more then a idea. They ARE, not only as letter forms : They are tangible. Exist, and occupy their own physical space.

Praise!

Hi Nick,  
I love this project of yours. I really hope it gets put to use, I can see it used for upmarket posters/signage in a store like FRESH & WILD, a campanion to the chalk board lettering.  
best of luck with it.

I know it's an old thread ... but WOW!

Awesome stuff!

----------  
**Paul Ducco**  
 [Graphic Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317173530/http:/www.solid-creative.com/)

It inspired me to do some designs using the negative shapes of type.  
I love it.
